content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 0 is:

6 -> 4 -> 5 -> 0

This path uses the edges in the graph that connect node 6 to nodes 4, 5, and 0. The shortest path follows these edges in the order they are listed in the graph. Please note that this is the shortest path regardless of the order in which the nodes are visited. If the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path would be:

0 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6

which is the reverse of the original shortest path.

The shortest path from node 0 to node 6 is:

0 -> 4 -> 6

This path uses the edges in the graph that connect node 0 to nodes 4 and 6. The shortest path follows these edges in the order they are listed in the graph. Please note that this is the shortest path regardless of the order in which the nodes are visited.
